cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward southeastern Louisiana, then forecast to slow and turn west along the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (around Morgan City to the Mouth of the Pearl River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA; Hurricane Watch Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City; Tropical Storm Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS; Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border incl. New Orleans lakes
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from the Texas–Louisiana border eastward through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Houston/Galveston area Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents along the upper Texas coast could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
